content.description:
A good, stiff, exercise in edging on brown and gold patina. Reasonably steep and technical for it's first half, on holds that are quite sharp. The top half of the route is unprotected but is easy. This route is surprisingly good in spite of its easy top half and is challenging enough to be worth the effort.

The down side - there are only two bolts, falls on the route could be quite serious given the bolt spacing and the location of the first bolt.

With a little thoughtful upgrading this route could conceivably merit another star.
content.location: This is the center route, and starts off the obvious flake at the base of the wall.

content.description: A tricky combination face/lieback problem up the left leaning seam.  A series of difficult moves for about 30' takes one off the flake at the base of the wall to the point where the angle changes.  Above the angle change wander up the easy face.  A bit stout for the grade.
content.protection: Top rope.  No known leads at this time.
content.location: This is the left most route on the boulder, and follows the left leaning seam.

content.description:
This is a challenging edging problem up the faint right leaning dike on the right hand side of the boulder. The crux is the sequence of moves passing the second bolt on its left, and involves moves on super slick quartz crystals. Above the last bolt wander up the increasingly easy face to the summit.

The second clip is thin, a quick clip setup with a runner might be a good idea in order to stay off the ground. The second bolt could have been placed a few moves lower but then it wouldn't have adequately protected the next section given the proximity of the ground. Given the need for the bolt to be where it is, the placing of the bolt was quite entertaining on the FA, with falls being taken to get it in (good job by KP).
content.location: The rightmost route on the face.
